shortdesc.ph: Reports the volume information of users.

section.p: This callback is disabled by default, and you can enable it through. After it is turned on, as long as there are streaming users in the channel, the SDK will trigger a callback at the time interval set in after joining the channel. The SDK triggers two independent `onAudioVolumeIndication` callbacks simultaneously, which separately report the volume information of the local user who sends a stream and the remote users (up to three) whose instantaneous volumes are the highest.
section.note:
After this function is enabled, if a user mutes themselves (calls ), the SDK behavior will be affected as follows:
If the local user calls `muteLocalAudioStream`, the SDK stops triggering the local user's callback.
20 seconds after a remote user whose volume is one of the three highest calls `muteLocalAudioStream`, the remote users' callback excludes this remote user's information; 20 seconds after all remote users call `muteLocalAudioStream`, the SDK stops triggering the remote users' callback.

plentry.pd: The volume information of users. An empty speakers array in the callback indicates that no remote user is in the channel or sending a stream at the moment.

pd.p:
amount of users.
In the local user's callback, when the local user sends a stream, `speakerNumber = 1`.
In the remote users' callback, the value ranges between 0 and 3. If the number of remote users who send streams is greater than or equal to three, `speakerNumber = 3`.

/The volume of the speaker. The value ranges between 0 (lowest volume) and 255 (highest volume).
In the local user's callback, totalVolume is the volume of the local user who sends a stream.
In the remote users' callback, totalVolume is the sum of the volume of all remote users (up to three) whose instantaneous volumes are the highest. In the local user's callback, totalVolume is the volume of the local user who sends a stream.
